snippet: One of the two programs that monitor greenhouse gases said that it had revised a reading suggesting that carbon dioxide had surpassed the symbolic level of 400 parts per million.
abstract: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, one of two programs that monitor greenhouse gases, says that it has revised reading suggesting that carbon dioxide in the air had surpassed symbolic level of 400 parts per million, to 399.89 parts per million; Scripps Institution of Oceanograpy continues to show level of 400.08 parts per million for the period.
lead_paragraph: One of the two programs that monitor greenhouse gases said that it had revised a reading suggesting that carbon dioxide had surpassed the symbolic level of 400 parts per million.

headline.main: Crucial Carbon Dioxide Reading Revised Downward
headline.print_headline: Crucial Carbon Dioxide Reading Revised Downward
